update.description:
This PR adds support for component serialization / de-serialization into streams.

* It uses the **stream operators** (`<<` / `>>`) for convenience when dealing with several standard types and Ignition Math types.
* Supports **custom serialization**, which can be defined by either:
    * Overriding `De/Serialize` functions (see an example on the `LevelEntityNames` component)
    * Defining custom operators - this is less convenient because as free functions, they'd need to be implemented in a `cc` file
* Supports **components that can't be serialized**. This means there's no compilation failure for components whose data doesn't have stream operators. Instead, a warning is printed if there's an attempt to serialize/deserialize them. Take a look at the `to/fromStream` functions.

---

## Next steps

* Implement serialization for types which currently don't support it, mainly those wrapping `sdf::ElementPtr` and other SDF classes. This may involve storing Ignition Messages instead.
* Implement serialization of the whole ECM, which is already under way in the `streaming` branch.

---

Thanks @carromj for bouncing ideas about how to implement the SFINAE rules.
update.title: [A-4] Component serialization

update.description:
This PR adds support for component serialization / de-serialization into streams.

* It uses the **stream operators** (`<<` / `>>`) for convenience when dealing with several standard types and Ignition Math types.
* Supports **custom serialization**, which can be defined by either:
    * Overriding `De/Serialize` functions (see an example on the `LevelEntityNames` component)
    * Defining custom operators - this is less convenient because as free functions, they'd need to be implemented in a `cc` file - :warning: and it's not working with clang, only with gcc
* Supports **components that can't be serialized**. This means there's no compilation failure for components whose data doesn't have stream operators. Instead, a warning is printed if there's an attempt to serialize/deserialize them. Take a look at the `to/fromStream` functions.

---

## Next steps

* Implement serialization for types which currently don't support it, mainly those wrapping `sdf::ElementPtr` and other SDF classes. This may involve storing Ignition Messages instead.
* Implement serialization of the whole ECM, which is already under way in the `streaming` branch.

---

Thanks @carromj for bouncing ideas about how to implement the SFINAE rules.

content.raw: These ones will be tough, because the reason this function is called is because it is in the base class, so I don't have the specific type. But I'll do this for the others.
content.html: These ones will be tough, because the reason this function is called is because it is in the base class, so I don't have the specific type. But I'll do this for the others.

content.raw: Specifically thinking of something like ROS\_LOG\_THROTTLE: [https://github.com/ros/rosconsole/blob/melodic-devel/include/ros/console.h#L454](https://github.com/ros/rosconsole/blob/melodic-devel/include/ros/console.h#L454)
content.html: Specifically thinking of something like ROS_LOG_THROTTLE: https://github.com/ros/rosconsole/blob/melodic-devel/include/ros/console.h#L454

content.raw: I think it would be safe to keep the immutable version as well, and let the compiler use it where it can.
content.html: I think it would be safe to keep the immutable version as well, and let the compiler use it where it can.

content.raw: Also, do we have a concept of a throttled logger in `ign-common`?  It seems like this could get really noisy if we try serializing a whole bunch of components not implementing serialization.
content.html: Also, do we have a concept of a throttled logger in ign-common? It seems like this could get really noisy if we try serializing a whole bunch of components not implementing serialization.

content.raw: It would probably be useful to output the `DataType` in this case with either `typeid(DataType).name()` or `DataType::name`, to make it easier to trace where the warning is coming from.
content.html: It would probably be useful to output the DataType in this case with either typeid(DataType).name() or DataType::name, to make it easier to trace where the warning is coming from.

update.description:
This PR adds support for component serialization / de-serialization into streams.

* It uses the **stream operators** (`<<` / `>>`) for convenience when dealing with several standard types and Ignition Math types.
* Supports **custom serialization**, which can be defined by either:
    * Overriding `De/Serialize` functions (see an example on the `LevelEntityNames` component)
    * Defining custom operators - this is less convenient because as free functions, they'd need to be implemented in a `cc` file.
* Supports **components that can't be serialized**. This means there's no compilation failure for components whose data doesn't have stream operators. Instead, a warning is printed if there's an attempt to serialize/deserialize them. Take a look at the `to/fromStream` functions.

---

## Next steps

* Implement serialization for types which currently don't support it, mainly those wrapping `sdf::ElementPtr` and other SDF classes. This may involve storing Ignition Messages instead.
* Implement serialization of the whole ECM, which is already under way in the `streaming` branch.

---

Thanks @carromj for bouncing ideas about how to implement the SFINAE rules.
